## Dimensionality Reduction

Dimension reduction is a technique to reduce the number of features in a dataset. It is useful for reducing the complexity of a dataset, compression, denoising, whitening, and visualization. Here are some resources to learn more about it:


- [NeuroMatch Academy - Dimensionality Reduction (W1D4)](https://compneuro.neuromatch.io/tutorials/W1D4_DimensionalityReduction/student/W1D4_Intro.html)
- [A friendly introduction to Principal Component Analysis](https://peterbloem.nl/blog/pca) by Peter Bloem
- [Principal Component Analysis for Data Science (pca4ds)](https://pca4ds.github.io/)
